project.name: basic
project.notes: The Basic application allows you to manually control the robot with the arrow keys. You can also take a picture with the "p" key, detect an object with the "o" key, and take a picture of a colored shape with the "s" key. Note that you should connect the right wheel to MA and the left wheel to MD. See https://github.com/10Imaging/RoboSnap/wiki/Snap!-Basic-example for more information

block.comment: Set robot variables to ip address or hostname of robot

custom-block.comment: Up arrow moves motors MA and MD forward by setting to the speed value
Down arrow moves motors MA and MD backward by setting them to 0-speed which is -15 in this case.
The right arrow key moves to the right by stopping the left motor MD and only setting the right motor MA to the speed value of 15.
The space key will stop both motors MA and MD...
Pressing the "p" key will take a picture and view it on the Snap! stage.
Pressing the "o" key will get an object and "say" what the color and shape are.
Pressing the "s" key will take a picture and draw a box around the largest object that it finds of any color or shape and show it on the Snap! stage.

scripts.comment: Create a robot with MA connected to the right wheel MD connected to the left wheel connect RoboSnap to the USB port Use "up arrow" to move forward Use "down arrow" to move backward Use "right arrow" to move right Use "left arrow" to move left Use "p" key to take a picture and display it Use "o" key to detect a colored shape (make sure you put an object in front of the camera) Use "s" key to take a picture of a colored shape (again try some different shapes and colors) See https://github.com/10Imaging/RoboSnap/wiki/Snap!-Basic-example for more information.

block-definition.comment: Get the current value of the sensor (S1, S2, S3 or S4).

This block has 3 different methods (time, rotations, position) for running one or more motors (MA, MB, MC, MD). "time" allows you to run the motors for a designated amount of time which is specified in seconds. "rotations" allows you to rotate the motor for a specified number of rotations. For example, 1 will rotate the motor 1 complete rotation and 0.5 will rotate the motor halfway around. "position" will allow you to move the motor to a specific position. Position is based on pulses (similar to degrees since there are 360 pulses in 1 rotation). The speed value ranges between -100 and 100, where negative numbers move the motor in the reverse direction. The last parameter "wait", will wait until the condition is met before moving on to the next block. If "wait" is not used then the following block will start before the current block is completed.e.
Used to assign which sensors are connected to which sensor ports. Must be set before getting the sensor values.

inputs.input: TOUCHCOLOR INFRARED LIGHT SOUND TOUCH ULTRASONIC

block-definition.comment: Block is used to stop a motor (MA, MB, MC and/or MD) that is running "forever"

Used to take a 300x200 snapshot which is saved to the image directory specified (or the default of "/"). The filenames will be called img_*.png (or "img" will be replaced by the value set by "set image filename") * is a unique number starting with 0.
used to set the directory on the robot to store any captured images. This is an optional command. If not set, the default directory is the top level directory "/".
Used to set the prefix of the captured images. This is an optional command. If not set, the default prefix is "img".
This is a reporter block which return the current position of a specified motor (MA, MB, MC or MD).
This block will reset the value of the current motor position of specified motor (MA, MB, MC or MD) to 0.

Used to get the largest object found. If color and/or shape are provided then the largest object of that type is returned. The values: x, y, w, h, color and shape are returned. x,y is the center of the object and w is the width and h is the height of the bounding box around the object. The coordinates are based on the snap coordinate system (-240 to 240 in X and -180 to 180 in Y). Color and shape are the names of color and shape found - or UNKNOWN if unable to detect.

inputs.input: ANYANY RED ORANGE YELLOW GREEN BLUE PURPLE PINK
ANYANY CIRCLE TRIANGLE RECTANGLE PENTAGON HEXAGON HEPTAGON OCTAGON

block-definition.comment: Used to take a 300x200 snapshot that includes a box around the N shapes detected of the specified color and shape. The name of the color and shape is written below the box. The largest shape will use a blue box and the smaller boxes will be white. This command has 3 arguments N, color and shape. N is the number of boxes to display. The default is 1. If the color is specified then only objects of that color will be selected. If shape is specified then only objects of that shape will be selected. As with "take a picture", the images are saved to the image directory specified (or the default of "/") . The filenames will be called img_*.png (or "img" will be replaced by the value set my "set image filename"). * is a unique number starting with 0..

inputs.input: ANYANY RED ORANGE YELLOW GREEN BLUE PURPLE PINK
ANYANY CIRCLE TRIANGLE RECTANGLE PENTAGON HEXAGON HEPTAGON OCTAGON

block-definition.comment: The "run motor forever" block allows you to move one or more motors (MA, MB, MC, MD) given a set of speeds. The speed values range between -100 and 100, where negative numbers move the motor in the reverse direction. If you specify less speeds than the number of motors, then the last speed will be used for the remaining motors.

input.options: ANY RED ORANGE YELLOW GREEN BLUE PURPLE PINK
ANY CIRCLE TRIANGLE RECTANGLE PENTAGON HEXAGON HEPTAGON OCTAGON

block-definition.comment: This will draw the last picture you have taken that is stored in the directory set with"set image directory" and prefix set with "set image filename"

block.l: var sprite = this, stage = sprite.parentThatIsA(StageMorph), context = stage.penTrails().getContext('2d'), isWarped = sprite.isWarped, img = new Image(), left =0, top = 0; if (isWarped) { sprite.endWarp(); } //img.src = 'http://snap.berkeley.edu/half-snapshot.png'; img.src = 'data:image/png;base64,' + image context.save(); context.scale(1 / stage.scale, 1 / stage.scale); context.translate(left, top); context.rotate((sprite.heading - 90) * Math.PI/180); context.drawImage( img, 0, 0 ); context.restore(); stage.changed(); if (isWarped) { sprite.startWarp(); }
